enhancedContent.overview: The Ultimate Notion CRM Template transforms your Notion workspace into a powerful customer relationship management system modeled after industry-leading platforms like HubSpot. This comprehensive template provides everything you need to manage your sales pipeline, track customer interactions, and streamline support workflows without the hefty price tag of traditional CRM software. Built specifically for Notion users who want professional-grade CRM functionality, this template seamlessly integrates with your existing Notion workspace while maintaining the flexibility and customization Notion is known for. Whether you're a solopreneur, small business owner, or sales professional, this CRM gives you the structure and tools to nurture relationships and close more deals.

faqs.question: How do I get started with this CRM template?
faqs.answer: After duplicating the template to your Notion workspace, start by adding your contacts to the Contacts database. Then create deals associated with those contacts and customize the pipeline stages to match your sales process. The template includes helpful guides and example data to show you how everything connects.

faqs.question: What's included in this CRM template?
faqs.answer: You get three core interconnected databases: Deals (sales pipeline), Contacts (customer information), and Tickets (support requests). Each database includes pre-built views, filters, and formulas to track relationships, calculate values, and manage workflows. The template also includes dashboard pages for reporting and analytics.

faqs.question: Can I customize this template for my specific business?
faqs.answer: Absolutely! The template is fully customizable. You can add custom properties to any database, create your own pipeline stages, modify views and filters, and adjust the structure to match your exact business processes. It's designed to be a flexible foundation you can build upon.

faqs.question: What are the main use cases for this CRM?
faqs.answer: The template excels at managing B2B sales cycles, tracking consulting client relationships, coordinating support tickets for SaaS products, managing real estate prospects, and organizing freelance client projects. Any business that needs to track customer interactions and sales opportunities will benefit.
